title.narrative: PUBLIC FINANCE AND EFFICIENCY

description.narrative: Enhanced national systems that govern the volume, efficiency and impact of invested resources towards building resilience of the most vulnerable boys, girls and adolescents., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Public Finance And Local Governance, Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, national systems and policies are effectively addressing multiple deprivations affecting the most vulnerable boys and girls across the lifecycle, and building their resilience, through adequately funded social investments and rights-based quality social policies on the basis of adequately disaggregated data on children.

mailing-address.narrative: 1st Floor UN House Marine Gardens Christ Church BARBADOS

sector.narrative: Expanding and improving cash transfers for children
PF4C: Engagement with budget processes to improve social sector budgets (sufficiency, efficiency, effectiveness, transparency, equity)
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Technical assistance - Child poverty, Public Finance and Local Governance

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Enhanced national systems that govern the volume, efficiency and impact of invested resources towards building resilience of themost vulnerable boys, girls and adolescents.

description.narrative: UNICEF Eastern Caribbean Area (ECA), through the production of evidence on national budgets with a focus on social sectors, effectively contributed to sensitize key stakeholders from both Finance and social sectors on the importance of Public Finance for Children (PF4C) and to identify in five countries/territories ways to increase investments in sectors that matter for children and to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of public spending. | Status:Met | As-of Date:18/01/2022
